ray.rage.scene.controllers

Class OrbitController

  • java.lang.Object
    • ray.rage.scene.controllers.AbstractController
      • ray.rage.scene.controllers.OrbitController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Disposable, Throttleable, Node.Controller

    public class OrbitController
extends AbstractController
implements Throttleable
    A Node.Controller implementation that makes controlled nodes orbit another target node.
    Author:
    Raymond L. Rivera

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class ray.rage.scene.controllers.AbstractController

        controlledNodesList

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      OrbitController(Node orbitTarget)
      Creates a new controller to orbit the specified node.
      OrbitController(Node orbitTarget, float orbitalSpeed)
      Creates a new controller to orbit the specified node at the specified speed.
      OrbitController(Node orbitTarget, float orbitalSpeed, float distanceFromTarget)
      Creates a new controller to orbit the specified node at the specified speed and distances.
      OrbitController(Node orbitTarget, float orbitalSpeed, float distanceFromTarget, float verticalDistance)
      Creates a new controller to orbit the specified node at the specified speed and distances.
      OrbitController(Node orbitTarget, float orbitalSpeed, float distanceFromTarget, float verticalDistance, boolean faceTarget)
      Creates a new controller to orbit the specified node at the specified speed and distances, with the option to always keep facing the target.

    • Constructor Detail

      • OrbitController

        public OrbitController(Node orbitTarget,
                       float orbitalSpeed,
                       float distanceFromTarget,
                       float verticalDistance,
                       boolean faceTarget)
        Creates a new controller to orbit the specified node at the specified speed and distances, with the option to always keep facing the target.
        Parameters:
        orbitTarget - The target node to orbit.
        orbitalSpeed - The speed at which to orbit.
        distanceFromTarget - Distance from the target's center.
        verticalDistance - Distance from the orbital plane of the target's center.
        faceTarget - True if controlled nodes should always face the target. Otherwise false.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If orbitTarget is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If distanceFromTarget is not positive.

      • OrbitController

        public OrbitController(Node orbitTarget,
                       float orbitalSpeed,
                       float distanceFromTarget,
                       float verticalDistance)
        Creates a new controller to orbit the specified node at the specified speed and distances.

        Controlled nodes do not face the target by default.

        Parameters:
        orbitTarget - The target node to orbit.
        orbitalSpeed - The speed at which to orbit.
        distanceFromTarget - Distance from the target's center.
        verticalDistance - Distance from the orbital plane of the target's center.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If orbitTarget is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If distanceFromTarget is not positive.

      • OrbitController

        public OrbitController(Node orbitTarget,
                       float orbitalSpeed,
                       float distanceFromTarget)
        Creates a new controller to orbit the specified node at the specified speed and distances.

        Controlled nodes orbit the target's orbital plane by default.

        Parameters:
        orbitTarget - The target node to orbit.
        orbitalSpeed - The speed at which to orbit.
        distanceFromTarget - Distance from the target's center.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If orbitTarget is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If distanceFromTarget is not positive.

      • OrbitController

        orbitalSpeed - The speed at which to orbit.
        Throws:

      • setDistanceFromTarget

        public void setDistanceFromTarget(float distance)
        Sets the distance the center of controlled nodes should be from the center of the target node.

        The greater the distance, the larger the orbit.

        Parameters:
        distance - The distance, in world-space units.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the distance is not positive.

      • getDistanceFromTarget

        public float getDistanceFromTarget()
        Gets the distance from the target node's center.
        Returns:
        The distance, in world-space units.

      • setVerticalDistance

        public void setVerticalDistance(float distance)
        Sets the "altitude" from the controlled node's orbital plane based on its center.

        This value can be used to make an orbit go "higher" or "lower" relative to the target node's center.

        Parameters:
        distance - The distance, in world-space units.

      • getVerticalDistance

        public float getVerticalDistance()
        Gets the "altitude" from the controlled node's orbital plane.
        Returns:
        The distance, in world-space units.

      • setAlwaysFacingTarget

        public void setAlwaysFacingTarget(boolean enabled)
        Sets whether controlled nodes should always "look-at" their target node.
        Parameters:
        enabled - True if controlled nodes should always "look at" their target. Otherwise false.
        See Also:
        Node.lookAt(Node)

      • isAlwaysFacingTarget

        public boolean isAlwaysFacingTarget()
        Gets whether controlled nodes always face their target node.
        Returns:
        True if controlled nodes auto-face the target node. Otherwise false.

      • notifyDispose

        public void notifyDispose()
        Description copied from interface: Disposable
        Explicitly releases the internal resources held by this instance, making it unusable afterwards.

        WARNING: This method is meant to be used internally by the framework and not by game clients. Use directly only if you really know what you're doing.

        Specified by:
        notifyDispose in interface Disposable
        Overrides:
        notifyDispose in class AbstractController
